values: We use the Global spectral model dynamical core in the model. We follow the semi-implicit time-stepping framework.

Uses a correlated-k distribution method and a transmittance lookup table that is linearly scaled by optical depth to achieve high accuracy and efficiency. The algorithm contains 140 unevenly distributed quadrature points to integrate the cumulative probability distribution functions of absorption over 16 spectral bands. It employs the Clough-Kneizys-Davies (CKD_2.4) continuum model (Clough et al. 1992) to compute absorption by water vapor at the continuum band. Longwave cloud radiative properties external to the RRTM depend on cloud liquid/ice water path and the effective radius of ice particles and water droplets (Hu and Stamnes 1993; Ebert and Curry 1992).

Other: Natural Aerosols- Dust, Sea Salt (MACV2), Kinne et al 2013

Explicit ODSs: Explicit representation of Ozone Depleting Substances e.g. CFCs, HCFCs and Halons
liquid water path: Integrated liquid water path through the cloud kg m-2
Monte Carlo Independent Column Approximation: McICA
Other: Single Scattering Albedo, Aerosol optical depth
Explicit ODSs: Explicit representation of Ozone Depleting Substances e.g. CFCs, HCFCs and Halons
Monte Carlo Independent Column Approximation: McICA
We use vertical profile of Kz, Turbulent Kinetic Energy diagnostic based on Hong and Pan 1996 and Han et al 2016.
We use the large scale cloud microphysics and precipitation based on  Zhao-Carr cloud microphysics (Zhao and Carr (1997) and Sundqvist et al (1989))
Zhao and Carr (1997) and Sundqvist et al (1989)
We used zhao/moorthi's prognostic cloud scheme.
Gravity-wave drag is simulated as described by Alpert et al. (1988) . The parameterization includes determination of the momentum flux due to gravity waves at the surface, as well as upper levels

Alpert, J. C., 2004: Subgrid-scale mountain blocking at NCEP. 
Alpert et al, 1988: Mountain induced gravity wave drag parameterization in the NMC medium-range forecast mode
Convectively forced gravity wave drag (CHUN AND BAIK 1998)
SW radiation: Shortwave solar spectral irradiance.
Spectral model with a reduced gaussian transform grid
hybrid sigma-pressure: sigma system near terrain and isobaric above
9 types of Soil similar to Noah LSM
variable, not specifically related to soil
Some quasi-permanent frozen soil layers at high latitude/evelation, but no specific permafrost layer.

Infiltration excess runoff
Saturated surface runoff
Deep drainage
Differentiated drainage and runoff
some quasi-permanent frozen soil layers at high altitude/elevation
The heat treatment is done via explicit diffusion scheme
Fractional snow coverage depends on vegetation type and Snow Water Equivalent.
Prescribed vegetation based on Hurtt etal ., 2015
Other: shrubs, tundra, bare soil, cropland

Surface energy budget; net radiation; surface moisture and heat fluxes; soil heat flux; snow phase change heat fluxes; precipitation heat capacity fluxes. Surface moisture flux; transpiration; direct evaporation; intercepted canopy water evaporation; snow sublimation
The river routing is done based on the river destination fields.
Lakes are treated the same as ocean points in terms of SST and the extent of ice coverage.
Modified version of Noah land surface model (Ek et al., 2003)
Sub cyling: Sub cycling relative to tracers
Leap-frog + Asselin filter: Leap-frog scheme with Asselin filter
Includes a diurnal cycle of solar insolation,and the atmosphere and seaice ﬁelds passed to the ocean(windstress,freshwater,turbulent and radiative ﬂuxes) are updated every two hours.
Via coupling: Diurnal cycle via coupling frequency
We use vertical tracer advection based on PPM scheme
We use GM scheme for Eddy induced velocity and Flow dependant Added diffusivity
Eddy active: Full resolution of eddies
Minimal Background Value: Western boundary enhanced background plus weak laplacian
We use Enhanced vertical diffusion convection scheme
We use Diffusive boundary layer in the model with a mixing coefficient of 100m**2/s

Specific treatment
Campin and Goosse (1999) scheme
We use Non-linear split-explicit free surface scheme in Ocean
We transmit the surface pressure forcing to ocean via sea-ice

Sweeneyetal.(2005) compile a seasonal climatology of chlorophyll based on measurements from the NASA SeaWIFS satellite. The model uses visible light absorption based on  the optical  models of MorelandAntoine(1994).
The Horizontal grid in the ocean is tripolar and vertical is Z* coordinate.
We use GFDL-MOM4p1 as ocean component (Griffies et al., 2009)
Tripolar grid varing resolution (0.33 degrees between -10 to 10) reduces poleward to 1 degree
Range of horizontal resolution with spatial details, eg. 50(Equator)-100km or 0.1-0.5 degrees etc.
Other: Ice Strength Formulation: GFDL SIS
Ocean grid: Sea ice is horizontally discretised on the ocean grid.
